alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 3:38PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following area, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 515 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated another band of moderate to heavy rain moving into the Morongo Basin from the west and provide additional rainfall through 5 pm. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Twentynine Palms, Mitchell Caverns, Yucca Valley, Twentynine Palms Base, Ludlow, Amboy, Joshua Tree Lake Campground, Twentynine Palms Airport, Joshua Tree, Newberry Springs and Morongo Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
